page.title: 14BOWDEN VILLAGE (cont.)
page.content: There was a school in Bowden but this closed in the early 1940's because of a falling roll.Today, the younger children attend primary schools in Newtown and Melrose while secondary children go to Earlston High School. There is no village policeman the nearest police station being at St. Boswells which is about 2 miles away. A millionaire left a lot of money to Bowden to provide street lighting and Bowden was the first place in the Borders to have electric street lighting.This money lasted for many years so the villagers didn't have to pay any rates towards street lighting. But in the last few decades,because street lights have got more powerful and more expensive the money has run out.Most people enjoy living in Bowden and are against any major changes.
